intro: Ceropegia humpatana, commonly known as the Humpata ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in rock gardens.
